car.description: The Toyota Camry is an automobile sold internationally by the Japanese manufacturer Toyota since 1982, spanning multiple generations.
The Nissan X-Trail is a compact crossover SUV produced by the Japanese automaker Nissan since 2000. In third generation, it is a 3-row (which means 7-seater) SUV.

The Volkswagen Golf is a compact car produced by the German automotive manufacturer Volkswagen since 1974, marketed worldwide across seven generations, in various body configurations and under various nameplates â€“ such as the Volkswagen Rabbit in the United States and Canada (Mk1 and Mk5), and as the Volkswagen Caribe in Mexico (Mk1)

The Honda Civic is a line of cars manufactured by Honda. Originally a subcompact, the Civic has gone through several generational changes, becoming both larger and more upscale, moving into the compact car segment.
The Chevrolet Captiva is a compact crossover SUV that was developed by the South Korean manufacturer Daewoo, and has been sold by Chevrolet since 2006.
The Suzuki Gimny is a line of four-wheel drive off-road mini SUVs, made by Japanese automaker Suzuki since 1970.
The BMW 3 Series is a compact executive car manufactured by the German automaker BMW since May 1975. It is the successor to the 02 Series and has been produced in seven different generations.
The Jeep Cherokee is a line of American vehicles sold by Jeep under various vehicle classes.
The Mercedes-Benz GLC-Class (X253/C253) is a compact luxury SUV introduced in 2015 for the 2016 model year that replaces the former Mercedes-Benz GLK-Class.
The Hyundai Sonata is a mid-size car produced by the South Korean manufacturer Hyundai since 1985.
